words.phonetic: tə hæv ɛstiːeɪtʃ ɪn wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs pɑːkɪt
words.defineEn: to definitely succeed or win at a particular thing
words.defineVi: để chắc chắn thành công hoặc giành chiến thắng tại một điều cụ thể

examples: From the moment the negotiations failed, the die was cast and war was inevitable.
Instead of whistling in the dark about the inevitable disaster, we should be making plans for when it strikes.
The team knew they were going to lose the game, so they resigned themselves to the inevitable defeat and played their best anyway.
Ecological disaster was inevitable.
That carbon-based life is inevitable?
words.defineEn: bound to happen in a way that is impossible to avoid or prevent
words.defineVi: nhất định xảy ra theo cách không thể tránh hoặc ngăn chặn

examples: Inevitably, the cartoonists made a monkey of him.
The carbon tax will inevitably lead to an increase in energy bills.
Your clients will come to distrust you if you keep promising them the world and then inevitably fail to deliver.
Yes, inevitably, reading is a conversation between an author and a reader.
This inevitably has to happen.
words.defineEn: in a way that cannot be stopped or avoided, and certainly happens
words.defineVi: theo cách không thể dừng lại hoặc tránh được, và chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra

examples: The professor knew his subject from the ground up.
I know my stuff.
I know this town like the back of my hand.
No one knows the answer.
She knows the score.
words.defineEn: to be completely certain about something
words.defineVi: để được hoàn toàn chắc chắn về một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to allow or wait for a situation to become calmer or more stable after a significant change or serious dispute
words.defineVi: để cho phép hoặc chờ đợi một tình huống trở nên bình tĩnh hơn hoặc ổn định hơn sau một thay đổi đáng kể hoặc tranh chấp nghiêm trọng

words.defineEn: to check something in order to find out whether it happens or is the case
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra một cái gì đó để tìm hiểu xem nó xảy ra hay là trường hợp

words.defineEn: to do something just to make sure that something else will occur
words.defineVi: để làm một cái gì đó chỉ để đảm bảo rằng một cái gì đó khác sẽ xảy ra

words.defineEn: to do something that guarantees the happening of something else or that guarantees something will not happen
words.defineVi: để làm điều gì đó đảm bảo sự xảy ra của điều gì khác hoặc điều đó đảm bảo điều gì đó sẽ không xảy ra

words.defineEn: used to emphasize that it is obvious who will win a competition, comparison, etc. as the odds are undeniably uneven
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh rằng rõ ràng ai sẽ giành chiến thắng trong một cuộc cạnh tranh, so sánh, v.v. vì tỷ lệ cược không đồng đều là điều không thể phủ nhận

words.defineEn: used to say that something is undoubtedly true and there are no other alternatives or interpretations concerning it
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó chắc chắn là đúng và không có sự thay thế hoặc giải thích nào khác liên quan đến nó

words.defineEn: used to emphasize that under no circumstances would one do something or something would happen
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh rằng trong mọi trường hợp sẽ không làm điều gì đó hoặc điều gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: She left a positive review online for the restaurant where she ordered a pizza.
If you invest time and energy into learning and personal growth, you will see positive results in your life.
Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
Consuming prunes may have a positive impact on heart health by reducing LDL cholesterol levels.
Sticks and stones may break my bones, but my positive attitude will never falter.
words.defineEn: (of a person) completely sure about the truth or correctness of something
words.defineVi: (của một người) hoàn toàn chắc chắn về sự thật hoặc tính đúng đắn của một cái gì đó

words.phonetic: tə sɛt slæʃ pʊt ɛsbiː stɹeɪt
words.defineEn: to make sure everything is clearly understood by someone and there are no misunderstandings
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo rằng mọi thứ được hiểu rõ ràng bởi ai đó và không có sự hiểu lầm

words.phonetic: tə pʊt wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs mʌni ɔn
words.defineEn: *** to feel very sure that something is true or that somebody will succeed
words.defineVi: *** để cảm thấy rất chắc chắn rằng điều gì đó là đúng hoặc ai đó sẽ thành công

examples: The hollow center of rigatoni allows it to hold robust sauces and fillings.
When I tasted the tomato chutney, I was pleasantly surprised by the robust flavors.
Sarah is strong as an oak, effortlessly conquering physical challenges with her robust and unyielding strength.
The marinara sauce used a flavor enhancer made from sun-dried tomatoes, enhancing the robust and tangy taste.
But these faster techniques produce less robust resilience.
words.defineEn: displaying forcefulness and determination
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự mạnh mẽ và quyết tâm

examples: They're coming back very robustly in this lawsuit.
And then because we build it so robustly, we are able to also pass the DoD 901 Barge Explosive Test, where you have 83 pounds of plastic explosive going off 20 feet from the device multiple times.

You know, and unemployment is low and the economy is growing, and to give the Trump administration credit, it has grown more robustly than any of his detractors thought it would when he became president.

So the key switches themselves, they're optical mechanical, which basically means that they are very robustly built, so they're rated for 100 million presses, in this case, but that they are actually activated by a beam of light being broken by the key moving down.
Maybe you can't say what you’d advise the president, but the idea that we should push back at him, we should in some way let him know he’s not going to get away with this, more robustly than we did.
words.defineEn: in a determined and strong manner
words.defineVi: một cách kiên quyết và mạnh mẽ

examples: Don’t robustness.
words.defineEn: the quality of having determination and strength
words.defineVi: chất lượng của việc có quyết tâm và sức mạnh

examples: It's a slam dunk.
It seems like a slam dunk for the prosecution: your client confessed to the crime.
Just because you see ozone and methane and carbon dioxide and water vapor in the atmosphere, is that a slam dunk for life?
Still, that’s a bit short of a slam dunk explanation.
But I will tell you, here in Albany, amongst lawmakers, the response has not been a slam dunk.
words.defineEn: something that is sure to happen
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra

words.defineEn: to be imminent or unavoidable
words.defineVi: sắp xảy ra hoặc không thể tránh khỏi

examples: Jane sure ran a tight ship around here.
That player sure got the bird after he dropped the ball.
The boss sure aired his lungs when we lost another customer!
He felt sure about his answer during the exam.
You can be sure of that.
words.defineEn: feeling confident about something being correct or true
words.defineVi: cảm thấy tự tin về một cái gì đó là đúng hoặc đúng

examples: But buying a fund isn’t a sure-fire bet either.
If you have the disorder, sadly we don't have a lot of sure-fire treatments.
And that is a sure-fire sign something weird is going on.
words.defineEn: bound to succeed or happen as expected
words.defineVi: nhất định thành công hoặc xảy ra như mong đợi

examples: Surely she would guess the truth.
Surely she didn't have the nerve to say that to him?
If he continues to neglect his studies, he will surely come a cropper in the exams.
Surely you're not going to take that lying down!
If we get enough dirt on Jackson, surely we can expose him and bring him down.
words.defineEn: used to express an almost definite degree of certainty over what is being said
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện một mức độ gần như chắc chắn về những gì đang được nói

examples: Celebrities like Halle Berry, Kourtney Kardashian, and Vanessa Hudgens all swear by it.
Now, some people swear by certain treatments.
While some argue against it, others swear by its great power and effectiveness.
Twin swears by the, what she calls them, tomato-based french onion soup?
He read a book, which he swore by.
words.defineEn: to be certain that something is good or useful
words.defineVi: để chắc chắn rằng một cái gì đó là tốt hoặc hữu ích

words.defineEn: used to deny the possibility of something happening
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để phủ nhận khả năng của một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: May your wildest dreams come true!
A true leader walks the talk.
The true story inspired many people around the world.
Calamity is man's true touchstone.
Her true feelings were finally out in the open.
words.defineEn: according to reality or facts
words.defineVi: theo thực tế hoặc sự kiện

examples: She was clearly speaking the truth.
Surely she would guess the truth.
She finally wormed the truth out of him.
There is truth in wine, after all.
She realized the truth in the saying 'a person with too much ambition cannot sleep in peace.'
words.defineEn: the true principles or facts about something, in contrast to what is imagined or thought
words.defineVi: các nguyên tắc thực sự hoặc sự thật về một cái gì đó, trái ngược với những gì được tưởng tượng hoặc suy nghĩ

examples: Samuel couldn't help but give Helen the glad eye during the dinner party, showing his undeniable attraction to her.
The artist struggled with self-doubt, but his mentor reminded him that if he was born to be hanged, then he would never be drowned - his talent was undeniable, and he was destined for greatness.
His voice was undeniable.
- That's undeniable.
But Stacey's efforts made an undeniable impact.
words.defineEn: absolutely certain or true; unable to be denied or questioned
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn chắc chắn hoặc đúng; không thể bị từ chối hoặc đặt câu hỏi

examples: But desalination undeniably uses a large amount of energy.
That is undeniably a large piece.
And Aston Martin is undeniably struggling.
While there are absolutely popular nonviolent games, undeniably violent games like Call of Duty, Counter-Strike, PUBG and Fortnight continue to be hugely successful.
The resulting taste is undeniably incredible.
words.defineEn: in a way that is definite and cannot be disputed
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là xác định và không thể tranh cãi

words.defineEn: uses to emphasize an opinion or the point one is making
words.defineVi: sử dụng để nhấn mạnh một ý kiến hoặc quan điểm mà người ta đang đưa ra

words.defineEn: used to show that someone has made a good suggestion or guess
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng ai đó đã đưa ra một gợi ý hay đoán

words.phonetic: tə bɛt wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs laɪf slæʃ buːts slæʃ bɑːɾəm dɑːlɚ
words.defineEn: used to state one's certainty about something happening or being the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để tuyên bố chắc chắn của một người về một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp
